channel.title: Comments on: Edit In Place: Version 0.2.1

item.title: By: Josh
item.dc:creator: Josh
item.description: Just a quick heads-up, but you may want to strip any input strings (and do any other validation you deem necessary) because right now, if you enter a bunch of spaces, the data is saved, but there is no link to go back and edit your text with.
item.content:encoded: Just a quick heads-up, but you may want to strip any input strings (and do any other validation you deem necessary) because right now, if you enter a bunch of spaces, the data is saved, but there is no link to go back and edit your text with.

item.title: By: joseph
item.dc:creator: joseph
item.description:
Bofe -
My bad, I had accidently posted the development version of EditInPlace example page. The color selector example will make use of a feature that will be available in the next release (hopefully). Sorry about that.
Thanks for letting me know about this.
item.content:encoded:
Bofe –

My bad, I had accidently posted the development version of EditInPlace example page. The color selector example will make use of a feature that will be available in the next release (hopefully). Sorry about that.

Thanks for letting me know about this.

item.title: By: bofe
item.dc:creator: bofe
item.description:
Joseph,
I'm having issues on the example page with the Color dropdown. Just the Save/Cancel buttons are showing up. (along with a Javascript error: $(element) has no propertiesprototype.js (line 1384))
I'm using Firefox 1.5.0.4 on WinXP if that's any help.
Keep up the great work!
item.content:encoded:
Joseph,

I’m having issues on the example page with the Color dropdown. Just the Save/Cancel buttons are showing up. (along with a Javascript error: $(element) has no propertiesprototype.js (line 1384))

I’m using Firefox 1.5.0.4 on WinXP if that’s any help.

Keep up the great work!
